intro: Pimpinella affinis f. oligactis, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It is native to North America and thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
